name: EVEREST VR™
description: Experience what it feels like to climb Mount Everest through a sequence of immersive first person locations as you strive to reach the top of the world. Incomparable visual fidelity combined with player agency in a VR journey that feels both real and emotionally stunning.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1 + Processor: Intel® i5-4590 or greater Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA Geforce® GTX 970 / AMD Radeon RX 480 or greater DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 11 GB available space Additional Notes: Recommend installing to SSD for faster performance
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10 Processor: Intel® i7-4790 or greater Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA Geforce® GTX 1060 or greater DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 11 GB available space Additional Notes: Recommend installing to SSD for faster performance

reviews.review_text: WOW! Really one of my best experiences for the vive and i have seen a lot. After over 3 months with the vive now i did not think that anything will amaze me again like at the start. but this... just wow.  Yes, it is short.  Yes, it is quite expencive.  But i enjoyed every single second of this journey and will keep it in my heart :) i espescially liked the small things in the game with the different (small) interactions. And it's quite nice that you are often placed in the corner of the room so you can walk across 2 or 3 meters. And of course the visuals with great background music.  I will absolutly show this to my friends just like theblu.  So if you have the money then it's easy 10/10

Quick, honest review: IF you aren't into everest or the outdoors, its probably not worth the money. If you are like me and enjoy hiking/the outdoors - this is worth every penny!! Can't wait to watch my mother in law lose her ♥♥♥♥ on the hillary step!
YouTube™ Video:  [ Everest VR ] Climb Everest and conquer your fear of heights in virtual reality
Amazing, it's short, but incredible, if this is even 5% of what everest is like it's incredible.

Everest VR is a great experience and you should buy it if you want to experience being on Everest, something that lets admit not many of us will ever get the chance to do outside of VR. It looks stunning on a 1080 with super sampling turned up.   Just be aware that this is not a game in the traditional sense but is in my view worth every penny. I expect that experiences like this are what will make VR mainstream in the future.

People complaining about lack of content probably don't understand how much work goes into a product like this. This is not your average polygon based space ping-pong VR game that has zero assets.  It's a photorealistic experience of being on Mt Everest and it does its job superbly.  Yes, it's short, but whatever you experience during that time is absolutely worth the money.  Think of it this way: how much would you pay to take your family on a 30-min IMAX experience of Mt Everest? This costs less than that and is a LOT more immersive.

So far a pinneacle of VR immersive experience . It's not a game, just a simulation where you do few steps, some short walk and climbing and it all takes 30 - 40 minutes max. Graphics is amazing indeed, no lags, absolutely seamless even having max setup (i7 Skylake Extreme 4.3GHz/ nVidia 980Ti/ 16MB/ Win10Pro 64). Your action perimeter is very, very limited.  Flip side of the coin is that will hardly play it again as the whole simulation is strictly build on linear script. 'Rollercoaster effect' is obvious: first ride is breath taking, second one still great but the 3rd one is a boredom. Not sure if great value for your money if worth of solid blockbuster regular game. Such stuff should come for free as a technology demo for Unreal Engine. I hope that makers will make some further extensions to spice & season more action in it. Must recommend YES as a VR fan and geek, if you expect gaming experience then blame yourself - you have been warned.

Much more of a tech demo than a full experience. The overall effect is good, and some of the detail works really well, but this is something to experience early in your VR career rather than after hours of gameplay. As it is, the interactive segments are very short and don't fit together well. There is good variety in day and night scenes, and some small parts which are really good - but plan to spend 30 minutes watching a short documentary, then decide if the price is right for you (compared with all those failed Kickstarters, its not a bad purchase)
Good News! You can'Complete' this 6 times and still be eligible for a refund. Massively over hyped and over charged.

Very disappointing - mainly because i had high hopes and also it was $25.00. If it was free or a couple of bucks fair enough, but at that price, too little conten andt no real gameplay of any note. A tech demo at best and even then i have many other demos that i would use to show off the vive before Everest VR.

Sadly priced way to high for not more then a little tech demo. Gameplay time is like 20 minuits or so and this includes the not needed tutorial.  There is much not used potential in this game, like having more climing and so on. more than 50% of this 20 minuits or so is loading time and flythroughs. If i wanted that there some (free) 4k videos on youtube which will to just alike.  I really can't recommend this game as its not a full game. I've played longer demos (Brookhaven e.g.).
Definitely not worth $25. It's too short and not very memorable.

This is an experience and not a game, but it tries to be a game and ends up not really doing anything. The tutorial shows you some stuff to do, but yet each is used once and is not any fun. The experience is quick, and half of it is spent towering over the mountain like in a helicopter with a narrator telling you stuff that isn't very helpful.   At the current price of $25, this needs to have a lot more involved in order to be worth it. Have us use our skills for climbing multiple objects, multiple ladders, making our way up the mountain slowly but surely. Make it seem adventurous - I felt like the entire climb would be incredibly easy to make when it really isn't. The visuals are there and there shouldn't need to be much extra work done for the environment, just in expanding the tasks. I want to work to climb Mt. Everest  As it is now, the game shouldn't be priced more than $10, just like The Blu, as it's basically the same thing. Add in more to the game for the price tag. I might repurchase once it hits $10, but I can't recommend.
This is NOT worth the asking price, if it was around $4.99 or under, then would be worth it.

The reviews are correct- I really wanted this to be a good VR experience to demo to new VR users, but the blu still will be my go to-  Which is a shame as it had lots of hype and has lots of potential, I would say it would be a buy at $10-15 but at the discounted $22 is still too much, hats off to Sólfar's marketing team as they really sold the heck of out this and made it out to be a lot more than what it really is..  Here is to hoping for some upates!

This is not a game and there's no content and you will be finish in 30min. Its worst part is they are charging 23 euro for it. Hands down I would stick with 'the blu' with fair price and more content than this piece of junk. Heck even indie developer does better job than this simulation. Until then thumbs down and refund.

I purchased this game and immediately got a refund. It's a great concept, but don't see how you can charge someone 22 bucks for a tech demo. Hopefully one of these devs release a full fledged VR experience.

This needs an update with more content and interactivity. Also, you can walk off ledges and hover in mid-air, which takes any fear out if it. Death should be a consequence. As of now, it's not worth the price.
Too expemsive for what it offers. It shouldn't cost more than 10bucks.

There was black texture problems all over the mountains as I would move my head around. It completely took me out of the VR experience. I searched everyone for any troubleshooting I could do to fix the problem. No help anywhere. It's entirely possible it was just an issue with my computer but I meet the system requirments and have a GTX 1070. I've had zero problems with any other VR game. This is the only game I have ever asked for a refund on.
